00003 using namespace kumonosu;
00007 RequestQueue::RequestQueue()
00008 {
00009     // Initialize the mutex
00010     pthread_mutex_init(&_dataStoreMutex, NULL);
00011 }

00016 void
00017 RequestQueue::addItem(int32_t serviceId, queueItem *item)
00018 {
00019     // Lock the data store
00020     pthread_mutex_lock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00021 
00022     // If the entry doesn't exist, create it
00023     if (_requestMap.count(serviceId) == 0) {
00024         std::queue<queueItem*> newServiceQueue;
00025         _requestMap[serviceId] = newServiceQueue;
00026     }
00027 
00028     // Add the item to the queue
00029     _requestMap[serviceId].push(item);
00030 
00031     // Unlock the data store
00032     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00033 
00034     // Unlock all the mutexes listening for items
00035     while (_itemAddedMutexList.size() > 0) {
00036         pthread_mutex_unlock(_itemAddedMutexList.back());
00037         _itemAddedMutexList.pop_back();
00038     }
00039 }
00040 
00044 queueItem*
00045 RequestQueue::getItem(int32_t serviceId)
00046 {
00047     queueItem* result;
00048     
00049     // Lock the data store
00050     pthread_mutex_lock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00051 
00052     // Verify if the queue exists to prevent accidentally creating it
00053     if (_requestMap.count(serviceId) != 0) {
00054         result = _requestMap[serviceId].front();
00055         _requestMap[serviceId].pop();
00056     }
00057 
00058     // Unlock the data store
00059     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00060     return result;
00061 }
00062 
00066 std::queue<queueItem*>
00067 RequestQueue::getItemQueue(int32_t serviceId)
00068 {
00069     std::queue<queueItem*> result;
00070     // Lock the data store
00071     pthread_mutex_lock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00072 
00073     // Verify if the queue exists to prevent accidentally adding it
00074     if (_requestMap.count(serviceId) != 0) {
00075         // Assign the queue
00076         result = _requestMap[serviceId];
00077         // This is the full queue, so remove from the map
00078         _requestMap.erase(serviceId);
00079     }
00080 
00081     // Unlock the data store
00082     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00083     return result;
00084 }
00085 
00089 std::queue<queueItem*>
00090 RequestQueue::getItemQueue(int32_t serviceId, int32_t count)
00091 {
00092     std::queue<queueItem*> result;
00093     int current_count = 0;
00094     
00095     // Lock the data store
00096     pthread_mutex_lock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00097 
00098     // Verify if the queue exists to prevent accidentally adding it
00099     if (_requestMap.count(serviceId) != 0) {
00100         while (current_count < count &&
00101                !_requestMap[serviceId].empty()) {
00102             result.push(_requestMap[serviceId].front());
00103             _requestMap[serviceId].pop();
00104             current_count++;
00105         }
00106 
00107         // Clean up the map if the last item in the queue was removed
00108         if (_requestMap[serviceId].empty()) {
00109             _requestMap.erase(serviceId);
00110         }
00111     }
00112 
00113     // Unlock the data store
00114     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00115     return result;
00116 }
00117 
00121 std::vector<int32_t>
00122 RequestQueue::getServiceIds()
00123 {
00124     std::vector<int32_t> result;
00125 
00126     // Lock the data store
00127     pthread_mutex_lock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00128 
00129     // Iterate over the map to retrieve each of the keys
00130     for (std::map<int32_t, std::queue<queueItem*> >::iterator it = _requestMap.begin();
00131          it != _requestMap.end();
00132          ++it) {
00133         result.push_back(it->first);
00134     }
00135          
00136     // Unlock the data store
00137     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_dataStoreMutex);
00138     return result;
00139 }
00140 
00141 void
00142 RequestQueue::queueLock(pthread_mutex_t* mutex)
00143 {
00144     pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
00145     _itemAddedMutexList.push_back(mutex);
00146 }
